text: <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in B cells

The fact that <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been reported to act as an autocrine stimulator in chondrocytes [ 18 ] and ovarium [ 19 ] , prompted us to investigate whether normal human B cells could produce <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> upon stimulation .

Ramos cells , which have been described to express <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA endogenously [ 20 ] , and the T cell line Jurkat , served as positive and negative controls , respectively .
Endogenous <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels in normal B cells were quantified by real-time RT-PCR after stimulation with anti-IgM for different time points .

Interestingly , the up-regulation of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was characteristic of an early-to intermediate inducible gene with maximal upregulation four hours after the addition of anti-IgM .

text: The level of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was back to baseline after 24 hours upon stimulation ( Figure 10 ) .

text: Furthermore , both FCS and human AB-serum induced significant upregulation of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA ( Figure 11 ) .

text: Interestingly , in a separate study we have found that normal human T cells do not express <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA after activation ( Sivertsen et al , manuscript in preparation ) .
Next , we wanted to detect <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in normal B-cells and tested various commercially available antibodies .

However , in our hands these anti - <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibodies did only recognize the recombinant <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein and not the native protein .
